dji.sdk.api.Gimbal

Class DJIGimbal

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.Gimbal.DJIGimbal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DJIInspireGimbal, DJIPhantomGimbal

    public class DJIGimbal
extends DJIObject

    Dji Gimbal Base Class

    DjiGimbal is the class for controlling the view of the drone. If you want to have a practical view and want to have a first personal view of the drone, gimbal could provide a special view for you. Also, if the objective is only focusing on one direction, the DjiGimbal could automatically stabilize the gimbal.

    You could use the DjiGimbal class to change the angle for detecting objects. However, in the PV2+, pitch of the gimbal is the only one direction which could be changed. Other directions, like roll and yaw, should be adjusted by turning the heading of the drone.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

    • Method Detail

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int intervel)
        Start updating timer and set the interval between each update. This function will set up an updating timer for updating the status of the Gimbal. This timer will periodically request information of gimal's attribute, errors (if it exists) and calibration status. Developer could use setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack, set GimbalErrorCallBack and setDJIGimbalCalibrationStatusCallBack to design the action while the sdk receives the information.
        Please Note that the interval could not be lower than 100;
        Parameters:
        intervel - The interval between each updating Timer. This will effect the frequency of transporting information from the aircraft.
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.

      • stopUpdateTimer

        public boolean stopUpdateTimer()
        Stop update timer.
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully stopping the updating timer
            false for informing failure.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        release gimbal interface

        Returns:

      • setGimbalFpvMode

        public int setGimbalFpvMode(boolean isFpv)
        Set up first personal view (FPV). Once you set up this view, you could get the FPV of the aircraft and the gimbal will not maintain its front-facing angle until you set it back.
        Parameters:
        isFpv - Set the fpv mode
         true - the module will be set to FPV.
         false - the module will adjust itself.
        Returns:
        void

      • updateGimbalAttitude

        public void updateGimbalAttitude(DJIGimbalRotation pitch,
                                 DJIGimbalRotation roll,
                                 DJIGimbalRotation yaw)
        Update the gimbal angle. Please notice that the parameters are instances of DJIGimbalRotation and please make sure that the parameters (enable, direction, type, angle) are set correctly
        Parameters:
        pitch - The pitch angle
        roll - The roll angle
        yaw - The yaw angle

      • setGimbalErrorCallBack

        public void setGimbalErrorCallBack(DJIGimbalErrorCallBack mCallBack)
        Set GimbalErrorCallBack
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The gimbal error callBack which will return the type of error by error codes.

        onResult(int error) - the error is the error code for different type of errors.

      • setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack

        public void setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack(DJIGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack mCallBack)
        Set GimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The gimbal update attitude callBack. This callback will return an instance of DJIGimbalAttitude which contains the gimbal's information of pitch, roll and yaw.

        onResult(DJIGimbalAttitude attitude) - attitude is an instance of DJIGimbalAttitude and it contains the value of pitch, roll and yaw.

      • getDJIGimbalCapacity

        public DJIGimbalCapacity getDJIGimbalCapacity()
        Using this function, the developer would get the gimbal capacity which could be used for identifying the property of the gimbal, such as maxYawRotationAngle.

      • getYawAngle

        public short getYawAngle()
        Return the yaw angle of the gimbal
        Returns:
        the base class will return a value of 0 for yaw angle.

      • setDJIGimbalCalibrationStatusCallBack

        public void setDJIGimbalCalibrationStatusCallBack(DJIGimbalCalibrationStatusCallBack mCallBack)
        Set up the DJIGimbalCalibrationStatusCallback
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - This is the callback for getting the information from the drone. And it will return a object of DJICalibrationStatus which will contain the relative information about self-calibration. onResult(DJIGimbalCalibrationStatus status) - status is the DJIGimbalCalibrationStatus object.
        See Also:
        DJIGimbalCalibrationStatus

      • setGimbalWorkMode

        public void setGimbalWorkMode(DJIGimbalTypeDef.GimbalWorkMode workMode,
                              DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Using this function the customer could adjust the gimbal work mode.
        Parameters:
        workMode - work mode will determine the gimbal work mode, for fpv, free-mode or yaw-follow mode
        mCallBack - - The execute callback.

        onResult(DJIError mErr) - mErr contains the execution result, succeed or fail.

      • startGimbalAutoCalibration

        public void startGimbalAutoCalibration(DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        Invoke this function the gimbal will start its self-calibration. While this function is in process, the gimbal will produce some sounds. This function is only supported by the Inspire 1.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The execute callback.

        onResult(DJIError mErr) - mErr contains the execution result, succeed or fail.
        See Also:
        startGimbalAutoCalibration(dji.sdk.interfaces.DJIExecuteResultCallback)

      • setRollFinetune

        public void setRollFinetune(int finetuneAngle,
                            DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallBack)
        This function will finetune the gimbal in a very small degree. It could be used to adjust the gimbal while it is not in a correct position. This function is only supported by Inspire 1. Phantom 2 series could not support this function.
        Parameters:
        finetuneAngle - the unit of this function is 0.1 degree
        mCallBack - return a DJIError object which will contain the information of execution result
        See Also:
        DJIError

      • updateGimbalAttitude

        public void updateGimbalAttitude(DJIGimbalRotation pitch,
                                 DJIGimbalRotation roll,
                                 DJIGimbalRotation yaw,
                                 DJIExecuteResultCallback mCallback)
        Update the gimbal angle. Please notice that the parameters are instances of DJIGimbalRotation and please make sure that the parameters (enable, direction, type, angle) are set correctly. This function has the execution result callback.
        Parameters:
        pitch - The pitch angle
        roll - The roll angle
        yaw - The yaw angle
        DJIExecuteResultCallback - the result callback

      • getFirmwareVersion

        public void getFirmwareVersion(DJIExecuteStringResultCallback mCallBack)
        Get the gimbal firmware version of inspire 1/Phantom 3 Series.
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - mCallBack is used to show the requesting version result.
